_header: The sin of pride nis not in shroud
Subjects: sermons, verse in; pride; sins, deadly
Bibliographic Ghosts: Cambridge UK, St John’s College F.22 (159)
_description: The sin of pride, a proverbial tag in the Fasciculus morum

BodLauMis111.Transcription:
þe synne of pride nys nouth in scrohudbut ys in herte þat
                    ys to proud
BodLauMis111.Note: Written as verse with rubric rhyme markers to right.

BodRawC670.Transcription:
The synne of pryde nys noȝt in schroudBut in herte þat is
                    to proude
BodRawC670.Editions:
Wenzel,  Siegfried. 
             Verses in Sermons: ‘Fasciculus morum’ and Its Middle
                English Poems.
         Cambridge, MA: Medieval Academy of America, 1978: 137.

OxfLinLat52.Transcription:
Þe synne of pride is nouȝt in schroudebut it is in hert
                    þat is to proudelet þi hert helden& it sall be
                    lykynqwath henynnyng

CamGon71.Transcription:
Þe syn of pride ys noght in schorudit ys in herth þat ys to
                    prudelat þi hert helde & þe schal leke

CamGon364.Transcription:
Þe synne of pride is nogth in schroudebut it is in herthe
                    þat is to prowdelet þi herte heldyn& it schal þe
                    lykyn without endyng
CamGon364.Note:
Erasure under ‘without endyng’; these words are squeezed in,
                    so probably initially ‘quod hendyng’.

EDU82.Transcription:
The synne of pryde is noȝth in shroudebut in hert þat is to
                    prowdeLett thy hert ȝelde an hit schal the lyke quod
                    hendyng

Lincoln44.Transcription:
þi synne of pryde is noȝt in stroweBot is in hert þat
                    is so to prowlete þi herte holde& hit þe wolde lyk quod
                    hyndyng

Spalding.Transcription:
The syn of pryde is noȝt in schoudebot is in hert þat is to
                    proudeyiue hert heldand it sal þe lyke and beld
Spalding.Note: With additional couplet; written as prose.

VaticanOtto.Editions:
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild. 
             A Register of Middle English Religious & Didactic Verse.
         2 vols. London: Oxford University Press for the Bibliographical
            Society: 1916-20: 2.6.
